channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- all products

item.title: CVE-2020-12963|2024-08-04T12:11:18.216Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient pointer validation vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows may allow unprivileged users to compromise the system.

item.title: CVE-2020-12930|2024-08-04T12:11:18.208Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Improper parameters handling in AMD Secure Processor (ASP) drivers may allow a privileged attacker to elevate their privileges potentially leading to loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2020-12967|2024-08-04T12:11:18.727Z -- amd -- sev%2Fsev-es
item.description: The lack of nested page table protection in the AMD SEV/SEV-ES feature could potentially lead to arbitrary code execution within the guest VM if a malicious administrator has access to compromise the server hypervisor.

item.title: CVE-2021-46792|2024-08-04T05:17:42.668Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) in the BIOS2PSP command may allow an attacker with a malicious BIOS to create a race condition causing the ASP bootloader to perform out-of-bounds SRAM reads upon an S3 resume event potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12982|2024-08-04T12:11:18.962Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An invalid object pointer free vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-39298|2024-08-04T02:06:42.610Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: A potential vulnerability in AMD System Management Mode (SMM) interrupt handler may allow an attacker with high privileges to access the SMM resulting in arbitrary code execution which could be used by malicious actors to bypass security mechanisms provided in the UEFI firmware.

item.title: CVE-2020-12897|2024-08-04T12:11:19.036Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Kernel Pool Address disclosure in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass.

item.title: CVE-2020-12951|2024-08-04T12:11:18.878Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Race condition in ASP firmware could allow less privileged x86 code to perform ASP SMM (System Management Mode) operations.

item.title: CVE-2021-46749|2024-08-04T05:17:42.293Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cpinnacle%20ridge%E2%80%9D
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) may allow for an out of bounds read in SMI (System Management Interface) mailbox checksum calculation triggering a data abort, resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46769|2024-08-04T05:17:42.984Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient syscall input validation in the ASP Bootloader may allow a privileged attacker to execute arbitrary DMA copies, which can lead to code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-12946|2024-08-04T12:11:18.980Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient input validation in ASP firmware for discrete TPM commands could allow a potential loss of integrity and denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46764|2024-08-04T05:17:42.271Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper validation of DRAM addresses in SMU may allow an attacker to overwrite sensitive memory locations within the ASP potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46767|2024-08-04T05:17:42.257Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the ASP may allow an attacker with physical access, unauthorized write access to memory potentially leading to a loss of integrity or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12983|2024-08-04T12:11:19.208Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privileges or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46754|2024-08-04T05:17:42.313Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker with a compromised Uapp or ABL to coerce the bootloader into exposing sensitive information to the SMU (System Management Unit) resulting in a potential loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2020-12898|2024-08-04T12:11:18.206Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Stack Buffer Overflow in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12894|2024-08-04T12:11:19.130Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Write in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x40010d may lead to arbitrary write to kernel memory or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12931|2024-08-04T12:11:18.233Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20rx%205000%20series%20%26%20pro%20w5000%20series
item.description: Improper parameters handling in the AMD Secure Processor (ASP) kernel may allow a privileged attacker to elevate their privileges potentially leading to loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-46768|2024-08-04T05:17:42.402Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in SEV firmware may allow an attacker to perform out-of-bounds memory reads within the ASP boot loader, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46766|2024-08-04T05:17:42.287Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%203000wx%20series%20processors%20%20%E2%80%9Cchagall%E2%80%9D%20ws
item.description: Improper clearing of sensitive data in the ASP Bootloader may expose secret keys to a privileged attacker accessing ASP SRAM, potentially leading to a loss of confidentiality.

item.title: CVE-2021-46794|2024-08-04T05:17:42.935Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in ASP (AMD Secure Processor) may allow for an out of bounds read in SMI (System Management Interface) mailbox checksum calculation triggering a data abort, resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12988|2024-08-04T12:11:18.981Z -- amd -- 1st%2F2nd%2F3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: A potential denial of service (DoS) vulnerability exists in the integrated chipset that may allow a malicious attacker to hang the system when it is rebooted.

item.title: CVE-2020-12920|2024-08-04T12:11:19.124Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: A potential denial of service issue exists in the AMD Display driver Escape 0x130007 Call handler. An attacker with low privilege could potentially induce a Windows BugCheck.

item.title: CVE-2020-12892|2024-08-04T12:11:19.033Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An untrusted search path in AMD Radeon settings Installer may lead to a privilege escalation or unauthorized code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46795|2024-08-04T05:17:42.312Z -- amd -- ryzen%205000%20series
item.description: A TOCTOU (time-of-check to time-of-use) vulnerability exists where an attacker may use a compromised BIOS to cause the TEE OS to read memory out of bounds that could potentially result in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12964|2024-08-04T12:11:18.701Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: A potential privilege escalation/denial of service issue exists in the AMD Radeon Kernel Mode driver Escape 0x2000c00 Call handler. An attacker with low privilege could potentially induce a Windows BugCheck or write to leak information.

item.title: CVE-2020-12987|2024-08-04T12:11:19.199Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: A heap information leak/kernel pool address disclosure vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass.

item.title: CVE-2021-46748|2024-08-04T05:17:42.605Z -- amd -- radeon%E2%84%A2%20rx%205000%2F6000%2F7000%20series%20graphics%20cards
item.description: Insufficient bounds checking in the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) may allow an attacker to access memory outside the bounds of what is permissible to a TA (Trusted Application) resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12900|2024-08-04T12:11:19.394Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An arbitrary write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon Graphics Driver for Windows 10 potentially allows unprivileged users to gain Escalation of Privileges and cause Denial of Service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12899|2024-08-04T12:11:18.946Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46758|2024-08-04T05:17:42.665Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D
item.description: Insufficient validation of SPI flash addresses in the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker to read data in memory mapped beyond SPI flash resulting in a potential loss of availability and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2020-12902|2024-08-04T12:11:18.204Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Decrement Privilege Escalation in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46744|2024-08-04T05:17:42.590Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: An attacker with access to a malicious hypervisor may be able to infer data values used in a SEV guest on AMD CPUs by monitoring ciphertext values over time.

item.title: CVE-2020-12904|2024-08-04T12:11:19.111Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Out of Bounds Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x3004203 may lead to arbitrary information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2021-46765|2024-08-04T05:17:42.365Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics%20%20%E2%80%9Ccezanne%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient input validation in ASP may allow an attacker with a compromised SMM to induce out-of-bounds memory reads within the ASP, potentially leading to a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12903|2024-08-04T12:11:18.704Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Out of Bounds Write and Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x6002d03 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12960|2024-08-04T12:11:19.103Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10, amdfender.sys may improperly handle input validation on InputBuffer which may result in a denial of service (DoS).

item.title: CVE-2021-46756|2024-08-04T05:17:42.446Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient validation of inputs in SVC_MAP_USER_STACK in the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker with a malicious Uapp or ABL to send malformed or invalid syscall to the bootloader resulting in a potential denial of service and loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2020-12966|2024-08-04T12:11:19.042Z -- amd -- 1st%2F2nd%2F3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: AMD EPYC™ Processors contain an information disclosure vulnerability in the Secure Encrypted Virtualization with Encrypted State (SEV-ES) and Secure Encrypted Virtualization with Secure Nested Paging (SEV-SNP). A local authenticated attacker could potentially exploit this vulnerability leading to leaking guest data by the malicious hypervisor.

item.title: CVE-2021-46759|2024-08-04T05:17:42.644Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Improper syscall input validation in AMD TEE (Trusted Execution Environment) may allow an attacker with physical access and control of a Uapp that runs under the bootloader to reveal the contents of the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader accessible memory to a serial port, resulting in a potential loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-46779|2024-08-04T05:17:42.420Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation in SVC_ECC_PRIMITIVE system call in a compromised user application or ABL may allow an attacker to corrupt ASP (AMD Secure Processor) OS memory which may lead to potential loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2021-46791|2024-08-04T05:17:42.675Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20epyc
item.description: Insufficient input validation during parsing of the System Management Mode (SMM) binary may allow a maliciously crafted SMM executable binary to corrupt Dynamic Root of Trust for Measurement (DRTM) user application memory that may result in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46753|2024-08-04T05:17:41.736Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Failure to validate the length fields of the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) sensor fusion hub headers may allow an attacker with a malicious Uapp or ABL to map the ASP sensor fusion hub region and overwrite data structures leading to a potential loss of confidentiality and integrity.

item.title: CVE-2020-12890|2024-08-04T12:11:19.090Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Improper handling of pointers in the System Management Mode (SMM) handling code may allow for a privileged attacker with physical or administrative access to potentially manipulate the AMD Generic Encapsulated Software Architecture (AGESA) to execute arbitrary code undetected by the operating system.

item.title: CVE-2020-12901|2024-08-04T12:11:19.064Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Arbitrary Free After Use in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to KASLR bypass or information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2020-12962|2024-08-04T12:11:19.192Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Escape call interface in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows may cause privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2021-46755|2024-08-04T05:17:42.829Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Failure to unmap certain SysHub mappings in error paths of the ASP (AMD Secure Processor) bootloader may allow an attacker with a malicious bootloader to exhaust the SysHub resources resulting in a potential denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12954|2024-08-04T12:11:18.706Z -- amd -- 1st%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A side effect of an integrated chipset option may be able to be used by an attacker to bypass SPI ROM protections, allowing unauthorized SPI ROM modification.

item.title: CVE-2021-46763|2024-08-04T05:17:42.477Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may enable a privileged attacker to write beyond the intended bounds of a shared memory buffer potentially leading to a loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-46774|2024-08-04T05:17:42.622Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%203000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Cmatisse%22
item.description: Insufficient DRAM address validation in System Management Unit (SMU) may allow an attacker to read/write from/to an invalid DRAM address, potentially resulting in denial-of-service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12986|2024-08-04T12:11:19.187Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient pointer validation vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may cause arbitrary code execution in the kernel, leading to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12905|2024-08-04T12:11:19.090Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Out of Bounds Read in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x3004403 may lead to arbitrary information disclosure.

item.title: CVE-2020-12981|2024-08-04T12:11:19.107Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient input validation in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may allow unprivileged users to unload the driver, potentially causing memory corruptions in high privileged processes, which can lead to escalation of privileges or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46760|2024-08-04T05:17:42.578Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20processors%20%E2%80%9Ccastle%20peak%E2%80%9D%20hedt
item.description: A malicious or compromised UApp or ABL can send a malformed system call to the bootloader, which may result in an out-of-bounds memory access that may potentially lead to an attacker leaking sensitive information or achieving code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46775|2024-08-04T05:17:42.634Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper input validation in ABL may enable an attacker with physical access, to perform arbitrary memory overwrites, potentially leading to a loss of integrity and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-12985|2024-08-04T12:11:19.044Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An insufficient pointer validation vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46771|2024-08-04T05:17:42.514Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient validation of addresses in AMD Secure Processor (ASP) firmware system call may potentially lead to arbitrary code execution by a compromised user application.

item.title: CVE-2021-46778|2024-08-04T05:17:42.676Z -- amd -- amd%20processors
item.description: Execution unit scheduler contention may lead to a side channel vulnerability found on AMD CPU microarchitectures codenamed “Zen 1”, “Zen 2” and “Zen 3” that use simultaneous multithreading (SMT). By measuring the contention level on scheduler queues an attacker may potentially leak sensitive information.

item.title: CVE-2020-12980|2024-08-04T12:11:19.003Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: An out of bounds write and read vulnerability in the AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12891|2024-08-04T12:11:18.664Z -- amd -- radeon%20software
item.description: AMD Radeon Software may be vulnerable to DLL Hijacking through path variable. An unprivileged user may be able to drop its malicious DLL file in any location which is in path environment variable.

item.title: CVE-2020-12965|2024-08-04T12:11:19.033Z -- amd -- all%20supported%20processors
item.description: When combined with specific software sequences, AMD CPUs may transiently execute non-canonical loads and store using only the lower 48 address bits potentially resulting in data leakage.

item.title: CVE-2020-12893|2024-08-04T12:11:18.856Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Stack Buffer Overflow in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x15002a may lead to escalation of privilege or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12929|2024-08-04T12:11:18.216Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Improper parameters validation in some trusted applications of the PSP contained in the AMD Graphics Driver may allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions and achieve arbitrary code execution .

item.title: CVE-2021-46773|2024-08-04T05:17:42.744Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%202000%20series%20desktop%20processors%20%E2%80%9Craven%20ridge%E2%80%9D%20am4
item.description: Insufficient input validation in ABL may enable a privileged attacker to corrupt ASP memory, potentially resulting in a loss of integrity or code execution.

item.title: CVE-2020-12961|2024-08-04T12:11:19.051Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: A potential vulnerability exists in AMD Platform Security Processor (PSP) that may allow an attacker to zero any privileged register on the System Management Network which may lead to bypassing SPI ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2020-12944|2024-08-04T12:11:18.939Z -- amd -- ryzen%E2%84%A2%20series
item.description: Insufficient validation of BIOS image length by ASP Firmware could lead to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46762|2024-08-04T05:17:42.237Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may allow an attacker to corrupt SMU SRAM potentially leading to a loss of integrity or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2020-12895|2024-08-04T12:11:18.755Z -- amd -- amd%20radeon%20software
item.description: Pool/Heap Overflow in AMD Graphics Driver for Windows 10 in Escape 0x110037 may lead to escalation of privilege, information disclosure or denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2023-31346|2024-08-02T14:53:30.943Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to initialize memory in SEV Firmware may allow a privileged attacker to access stale data from other guests.

item.title: CVE-2023-31347|2024-08-02T14:53:31.084Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Due to a code bug in Secure_TSC, SEV firmware may allow an attacker with high privileges to cause a guest to observe an incorrect TSC when Secure TSC is enabled potentially resulting in a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-08-01T22:35:34.619Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-08-01T22:35:34.611Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-07-24T18:06:16.832Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46757|2024-06-18T18:46:02.340Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20embedded%205000
item.description: Insufficient checking of memory buffer in ASP Secure OS may allow an attacker with a malicious TA to read/write to the ASP Secure OS kernel virtual address space potentially leading to privilege escalation.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-06-18T19:01:57.007Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-03-15T21:25:07.075Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2024-21972|2024-04-23T16:36:03.933Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-21979|2024-06-04T17:37:40.519Z -- amd -- amd%20software%3A%20adrenalin%20edition
item.description: An out of bounds write vulnerability in the AMD Radeon™ user mode driver for DirectX® 11 could allow an attacker with access to a malformed shader to potentially achieve arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-31346|2024-06-04T17:19:15.832Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Failure to initialize memory in SEV Firmware may allow a privileged attacker to access stale data from other guests.

item.title: CVE-2023-31347|2024-02-13T19:18:51.045Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Due to a code bug in Secure_TSC, SEV firmware may allow an attacker with high privileges to cause a guest to observe an incorrect TSC when Secure TSC is enabled potentially resulting in a loss of guest integrity.

item.title: CVE-2023-20579|2024-06-04T17:20:09.206Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper Access Control in the AMD SPI protection feature may allow a user with Ring0 (kernel mode) privileged access to bypass protections potentially resulting in loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20587|2024-02-13T19:32:33.392Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper Access Control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker access to the SPI flash potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20570|2024-06-04T17:20:10.498Z -- amd -- alveo%E2%84%A2%20card%20%28ultrascale%E2%84%A2and%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20based%29
item.description: Insufficient verification of data authenticity in the configuration state machine may allow a local attacker to potentially load arbitrary bitstreams.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-07-18T15:31:14.331Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2024-2193|2024-08-01T19:03:39.165Z -- amd -- cpu
item.description: A Speculative Race Condition (SRC) vulnerability that impacts modern CPU architectures supporting speculative execution (related to Spectre V1) has been disclosed. An unauthenticated attacker can exploit this vulnerability to disclose arbitrary data from the CPU using race conditions to access the speculative executable code paths.

item.title: CVE-2023-20587|2024-08-02T09:05:36.265Z -- amd -- 3rd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2%20processors
item.description: Improper Access Control in System Management Mode (SMM) may allow an attacker access to the SPI flash potentially leading to arbitrary code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-20579|2024-08-02T09:05:36.910Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%205000%20series%20desktop%20processor%20with%20radeon%E2%84%A2%20graphics
item.description: Improper Access Control in the AMD SPI protection feature may allow a user with Ring0 (kernel mode) privileged access to bypass protections potentially resulting in loss of integrity and availability.

item.title: CVE-2023-20570|2024-08-02T09:05:36.265Z -- amd -- alveo%E2%84%A2%20card%20%28ultrascale%E2%84%A2and%20ultrascale%2B%E2%84%A2%20based%29
item.description: Insufficient verification of data authenticity in the configuration state machine may allow a local attacker to potentially load arbitrary bitstreams.

item.title: CVE-2022-23829|2024-08-03T03:51:46.075Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20threadripper%E2%84%A2%20pro%20processors%205900%20wx-series
item.description: A potential weakness in AMD SPI protection features may allow a malicious attacker with Ring0 (kernel mode) access to bypass the native System Management Mode (SMM) ROM protections.

item.title: CVE-2021-46757|2024-08-04T05:17:42.302Z -- amd -- amd%20ryzen%E2%84%A2%20embedded%205000
item.description: Insufficient checking of memory buffer in ASP Secure OS may allow an attacker with a malicious TA to read/write to the ASP Secure OS kernel virtual address space potentially leading to privilege escalation.
